required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Late Phase II Study of TS-142 in Patients With Insomnia
clinical_study.official_title: Late Phase II Study of TS-142 in Patients With Insomnia

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, double-blind, multi-center, placebo-controlled, parallel-group exploratory study in patients with insomnia.

primary_outcome.measure: LS mean difference from placebo; Change between baseline and end of the study of sSL
primary_outcome.description: sSL is defined as the duration of time that it took to fall asleep as recorded in a sleep diary

secondary_outcome.measure: LS mean difference from placebo; Change between baseline and end of the study of sTST
secondary_outcome.description: sTST is defined as the total amount of time spent asleep before getting-out from his/her bed for the day as recorded in a sleep diary

secondary_outcome.measure: LS mean difference from placebo; Change between baseline and end of the study of sWASO
secondary_outcome.description: sWASO is defined as the total amount of time spent asleep before getting-out from bed for the day as recorded in a sleep diary

arm_group.description: Period in which participants received multiple-dose of 2.5 mg TS-142 prior to bedtime
Period in which participants received multiple-dose of 5 mg TS-142 prior to bedtime
Period in which participants received multiple-dose of 10 mg TS-142 prior to bedtime
Period in which participants received single placebo prior to bedtime

intervention.description: Participants received multiple-dose of 2.5, 5, 10 mg of TS-142 or placebo (oral tablet)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Japanese male and female age 20 years or older at the time of informed consent
- Outpatients
- Patients who meet the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, fifth edition (DSM-5) criteria for insomnia disorder
- Other protocol defined inclusion criteria could apply
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who meet the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, fifth edition (DSM-5) criteria excepting insomnia disorder preceding visit 1
- Patients who meet the DSM-5 criteria for Restless legs syndrome at visit 1
- Patients with comorbid psychiatric disorder(s), including depression, schizophrenia, anxiety
- Other protocol defined exclusion criteria could apply
